definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: † II. [[[חָרֵב]]] be waste, desolate (NH [[חָרֵב]] id.; Aram. [[חֲרוֹב]] h.rab be laid waste; Zinj. [[חרב]] adj.; Ar. xariba be in ruins, waste, depopulated; As. ḫarâbu, be waste, Dl:Pr 175, ḫuribtu, desert, Lotz:TP);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Impf. 3 fs. [[תֶּחֱêַרב]] Je 26:9, [[תֶּחֱêָרב]] Is 34:10; 3 mpl. [[יֶחֶרְבוּ]] Ez Eze 6:6, [[יֶחֱרָָבוּ]] Am 7:9, Is 60:12; 3 fpl. [[תֶּחֱרַבְנׇה]] Ez Eze 6:6, Eze 12:20; Imv. [[חָרְבוּ]] (so, not [[חָֽרְבוּ]]—Theile—see van d. H Hahn Kö:i. 244) Je 2:12; Inf. abs. [[חָרׂב]] Is 60:12; —be waste, desolate; of sanctuaries of Isr. Am 7:9 (‖[[נׇשַׁמּוּ]]), of altars Ez Eze 6:6; of cities Je 26:9, Ez Eze 6:6, Eze 12:20 (‖[[שׁמם]]); of nations Is 34:10, [[חָרׂב יֶחֱרָָבוּ]] Is 60:12 (‖[[יאׁבֵדוּ]]); fig., in address to the heavens [[חָרְבוּ מְאׂד]] Je 2:12—(‖[[שׁׂמּוּ]], [[וְשַׂעֲרוּ]]), be very desolate (at sins of Isr.); others, be amazed, astounded (on relation of meanings v. [[שׁמם]]).

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pt. f. [[נֶחֱרֶבֶת]] Ez Eze 26:19 as adj., desolate city, i.e. uninhabited, v. context; [[נַחֲרָבוֹת]] Eze 30:17 of desolate countries (‖[[נׇשַׁמּוּ]]).

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pf. [[הֶחֱרִיב]] Ez 19:17; 1 S. [[הֶחֱרַבְתִּי]] Zep 3:6; 3 pl. [[הֶחֱרִיבוּ]] Is 37:18, 2Ki 19:17; Impf. 1 S. [[אַחֲרִיב]] Is 42:15; Pt. [[מַחֲרִיב]] Ju Jdg 16:24; pl. c. sf. [[מַחֲרִיבַיִח]] Is 49:17; —lay waste, make desolate, human subj.; nations and lands Is 37:18 = 2Ki 19:17, Is 42:15, cf. pt. Is 49:17 (‖[[מְהָֽרְסַיִח]]); add prob. with We Am 4:9 ([[הֶחֱרַבְתִּי]] for the untranslateable [[הַרְבּוֹת]]) I have devastated your gardens and vineyards; pt. Ju Jdg 16:24 desolater of our country (‖[[הִרְבָּה אֶת־חֲלָלֵנ֑וּ]]); obj. cities Ez Eze 19:7; streets Zep 3:6 (‖[[נׇשַׁמּוּ]]).

definitions.title: Hoph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 fs. [[הָחֳרָָבָה]] Ez Eze 26:2 she is laid waste, of a city; Pt. [[מָחֳרָבוֹת]] Ez Eze 29:12 laid waste, of cities (‖[[שׁמם]]).
